comments.content: There is a good point in the statement: "lists customers and their activities". Single stream does not list both. Tricky question. I'll go with multi-stream because it also has tiles if you turn it on.
Correct, the tiles are available only on single stream

discussion.content: Dashboards that permantly show tiles are single stream. It even says in the source. "The tiles are positioned on the right side of the dashboards and are always shown"

It was part of my exam,3 days ago
For the second one:single stream.

It lists customers and their activities and Must have Tiles.

While single stream can only have one stream and might have /might not have tiles.
So I will go with Multi Stream as answer.

Interactive dashboards come with two forms: Single-Stream and Multi-Stream. A stream is another name of a CRM view, so multi-stream dashboards come with multiple streams connected to a single entity. For example, the case entity connects to other entity streams like queue, activities, etc. In Single-Stream you can choose only one stream but you are able to add more charts and tiles.

On exam 27/4/22. Passed. I selected
Interactive dashboard
Single-stream
Home page

IE Dashboard allows you to directly interact with records. In this case, you can create a single stream IE Dashboard for Accounts, which allows you to interact with activities associated with account records. 
Single stream dashboards are not available at Entity Level. Therefore, you must create the dashboard on Home Page.

discussion.content:
Creation Location - Entity

From https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/configure-interactive-experience-dashboards

Configure an entity-specific dashboard
An entity-specific dashboard is a multi-stream dashboard. Configuring this dashboard is similar to configuring a home page multi-stream dashboard, but you do it in the different place in the UI and there are other minor differences. For example, instead of selecting an entity, some fields in the entity-specific dashboard are preset to the entity for which you are creating the dashboard.

Go to Settings > Customizations > Customize the System.

Under Components, expand Entities and select the entity you want. Select Dashboards under the entity, in the navigation pane.

In the grid, select New, and then select Interactive experience dashboard in the drop-down list.

Choose the layout, either 2, 3, or 4 column width.
If it is single-stream, then wouldn't the creation location also be entity because home page is only for multi stream?

comments.content: Multi-stream can be homepage or entity specific - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/configure-interactive-experience-dashboards

discussion.content:
The tiles are available also by Multi stream. 
"Multi-stream dashboard tile view"
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customerengagement/on-premises/customize/configure-interactive-experience-dashboards

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 administrator for a company. The company's fiscal year is April 1 through March 31.
You need to create a system view for all users that displays data for the current fiscal year by default.
What should you do?

choices.A: Set up fiscal year settings and create a view in the default solution
choices.B: Use date ranges to create a view in the default solution
choices.C: Set up fiscal year settings and create a view from the advanced find
choices.D: Use date ranges to create a view from the advanced find
